column1: share on facebookshare on twittershare on emailmore sharing services express sympathy condolences photos rose marie guarino, 80, of orange, passed away on june 19, 2015 in yale new haven hospital surrounded by her family. she was the loving wife of louis t. guarino for 58 beautiful years. born in new haven july 15, 1934, she was the daughter of the late joseph and josephine del. vecchio guarino. she was a graduate of hillhouse high school. she has been an orange resident since 1963 and was a parishioner of holy infant church. she was a woman of faith who believed with all her heart that one day she would be reunited with all those she loved. she was blessed to have along and happy marriage that was full of laughs and the pure enjoyment of spending time with her husband. after a 30 year career at sears & roebuck co., she retired in 1994 and dedicated her time as a wonderful mom to her children and an incredibly spirited ahma to her grandchildren. being a grandma was the best job in the world to her. she was the biggest and most enthusiastic fan of everything they did. she worked hard to keep the italian family traditions going. being with family and watching everyone interact brought a smile to her face. she was an active participant at the orange senior center for many years and had many dear friends there. she loved her yoga class and senior aerobics. besides her husband, she is survived by her son, michael (susana) guarino of hoboken, n. j.; her daughter, lori hoffer of woodbridge; a brother, vincent guarino of west haven; a sister, carol (nick) cusano of guilford; four grandchildren, michael (elizabeth) guarino jr., katie (john) de. leo, jennifer and jessica hoffer; and great grandchild, jack de. leo. friends are invited to attend a mass of christian burial at holy infant church, 450 racebrook road, orange monday morning at 10:00. interment will follow in orange center cemetery. the family will receive visitors at 16 shady lane, woodbridge on monday from noon to 8:00 pm. in lieu of flowers, contributions in her memory may be made to the national kidney foundation, 1463 highland avenue, cheshire, ct 06410. click to send flowers using our local area florist free delivery to our funeral home & save on wire fees view/sign the condolence book. you have items in your basket. click here to review and/or checkout order directly from our recommended local area florist via our website and save on wire service fees and delivery charges to our funeral home. browse selection. click the button to generate a printable document containing all condolences submittedcondolence booklet. add condolence copyright 2015 celentano funeral home. all rights reserved. website by cfs
